meanings.definition: To get back or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim worked hard to reobtain it.
meanings.sent2: She was determined to reobtain her stolen necklace.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reobtain its toy from the mischievous puppy.
meanings.sent4: With great effort, he managed to reobtain his lost wallet.
meanings.sent5: The explorer finally reobtained the ancient artifact after years of searching.

meanings.definition: To recover something that was lost or taken away.
meanings.sent1: The detective was able to reobtain the stolen painting.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to reobtain her lost phone before the battery died.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to reobtain the vanished rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent4: The student was relieved to reobtain his misplaced homework before class.
meanings.sent5: The hiker managed to reobtain his dropped map and continue on the trail.
